attributes.action: Why we can't pay for Germany to sell cars to the UK
attributes.additional_details:
At a conservative average of £30K that totals £19.6B and represent a huge number of jobs in Germany. This petition states it would be criminal if any UK government were to agree a deal where UK has to pay to sell to the EU, and Germany continues to sell to us for free.  This must never happen. 

http://www.carmagazine.co.uk/car-news/industry-news/ford/uk-2014-car-sales-analysis-winners-and-losers/

The top 4 german car makes alone accounted for 25% of over 2.4 M units sold in 2014.
attributes.background: In 2014, the big 4 German car firms sold 640,000 new cars in the UK.

rejection.details: Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
